'''celebrin''' is a [[Sindarin]] adjective meaning "like silver (in hue or worth)".<ref>{{PE|Eldarin}}, entry ''S'' '''Celebrimbor''', p. 42</ref> It is composed of the noun ''[[celeb]]'' ("silver") + ''[[-ren]]'', an adjective suffix.<ref name=Eld>{{webcite|author=[[Paul Strack]]|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-281453255.html|articlename=S. ''celebrin'' adj.|website=Eldamo|accessed=11 August 2022}}</ref>

== Cognates ==
* [[Quenya]]: ''[[telperin]]''<ref name=Eld/>

== Other versions of the legendarium ==
Words similar to, and with a similar meaning appear all the way to the earliest [[legendarium]]:

* In [[Gnomish]], a very early precursor to Sindarin associated with ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]'', there appear the adjectives ''[[celebriol]]'' and ''celebrin'', meaning "like silver" and "of silver", respectively.<ref>{{PE|11}}, entries '''celebriol''' and '''celebrin''', p. 25</ref>
* In [[Noldorin]], a somewhat later precursor to Sindarin, there appears the adjective ''[[celebren]]'', likewise meaning "of silver, like silver".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry '''KYELEP-''', pp. 366-7</ref>
